reviewText:
The description of the game claims that it is quite complicated. But in reality the game is very simple. What’s complicated is figuring out how all these poor game design decisions came together to form this mess of mechanics.

Zombie Zoeds pits you as a nameless thing shooting other things. You can only shoot in the direction you are facing, and moving around feels like you are steering a cart drawn by dead horses. Your character has to forcibly swing himself around like a boat in order to change the direction he is facing. But all of these clunky movements fit perfectly because your bullets actually fire off center. So while you are surrounded by zombies and being mauled from all sides, you will soon discover that the zombie directly in front of you is actually dodging all of your bullets because he is in front of you and your character wields his gun completely to the side of what he is looking at. It gets even better though, because this particular gun you start with (the Patron) is modeled after Haley’s comet because you only shoot one bullet every 75 years or so. You also shoot bullets the size of threading needles. So don’t ever worry about trying to hit an enemy on purpose, because this is mostly a game of waddling around and clicking in hopes of hitting something.

I have no idea where the game goes beyond that. You have some kind of score based on your kills and also how many survivors die. This score doesn’t really go anywhere. There is for the weapons “Lazer” and “Lazer 2” at the bottom of the screen but I don’t think I can commit to ever finding those weapons. Along with the lack of goals, the game is incredibly bland in general. The game’s sound design is brought to you by public domain night sounds, nonstop. The art style has poor color choices and too much repetition in general.
The trees in the game all look the same and, together with the ground, seem to be from a completely different style from the enemies and player. Despite this being a top-down game, the trees all have their trunks visible and don’t follow the perspective. On top of this, these trees are surrounded by an invisible box that is impassable. This means that your game of wildly unintuitive shooting and movement is also interrupted by these clone trees wielding force fields. They are out of place stylistically and I have no idea what they add to the game. There is no need to take cover behind them because that would require quicker movements than your character would allow. These trees also don't provide resources, because this game has no mechanics beyond shooting the same stock enemies for no other goal than to watch a number get bigger.  The trees also fail at being landmarks because they all pretty much look the same, and chances are if you are close enough to see them, you are probably in danger of being caught up in their invisible walls.

You are controlling an old boat disguised as a person, shooting tiny straws slowly around your enemies while treading through treacherous waters of mismatched art, trees, and no sense of purpose.  This game needs landscaping among so many other things.

reviewText: Okay, wow, heh. Zombie Zoeds is a top down shooter the kind where u kinda run around the map and shoot at ennemies swarming you. But unlike the ones you might have played on websites for free, this game does not even feel like an excuse to have ads in, it doesnt even feel like it pretends to be fun, its just very bad. First off pressing R for reload or Q or any keys you arent supposed to will shut down the ambiant sound for no reason. The Menu only has start game and load, no options, the game doesnt have any intro, or end/death screen, you just are dumped onto the same ♥♥♥♥♥♥ grass map with a few trees here and there, dont get near the trees your character will glitch out a bit and move about randomly. You are armed with basically a BB gun, and , lol, the pellets for it are called patrons for some reason, its kind of funny and induced me some kind of feeling of shame that I owned the title by that point, and that was only a minute in. You cant aim your bb gun at all, you gotta just press the mouse button and your character will blindly fire forward, at a very slow pace, aiming is thus reduced to your ability to move your character, but the controls with WASD dont really have diagonals, and if you are just a little off target by being too high or too low you will miss, so to readjust you have to do this cumbersome little dance where you move back not to get caught, go down, turn around to face the ennemy, but by then the zombie is on you and you gotta move away anyway, there is no animation to speak of and the zombies just drag around frozen still with their arms extended. So all things considered this isnt a top down shooter at all, this is a patience game, like solitaire, and your main weapon isnt your gun, its the ai`s desire to returned to their original spot after chasing for a while. So basically this is a very boring game where you kite uninspired ennemies in a clunky forgettable and ugly game and slowly chip at them with no satisfaction whatsoever. I mean I have always had a very generous nature when it comes to supporting devs, even untalented ones, or ones with dubious business practices, I just like to get everything and try it out. But ... this really feels like someone is trolling, and making a few bucks while they are at it. It is an insult of a game, and really tarnishes steam`s image in my humble opinion.

The game drops you in a dark area, with no objective, and nothing but a torch and an Automatic Kalashnikov for company. The lack of an objective or any instructions really brings out the survival horror elements of the game, showing the player of the chaotic world they are about to find themselves in.

You can't go too far without noticing the harsh reality you suddenly find yourself in. The world has been overrun with infected humans, and these flesh craving beings will stop at nothing to tear you apart, limb from limb. Your character, dressed in blue and armed and deadly, must protect himself from these hellish things the only way he can, with his Shooting iron and his wits. You can only shoot in the direction you are facing, and the only way to turn is to walk, this is some next level immersion, true survival grit, and a very daring move for the devs. This has payed off, as I found myself completely immersed in the game, and it really brings out its survival horror elements.

The zombies I found to be quite realistic, and their movement patterns, as well as their movement speed, are very reminiscent of games such as Left 4 Dead. The scarcity of ammunition is such an important addition to the games whole survival feeling, and running out of ammunition can really bring out the best survival elements of the game.
At the bottom of the screen, there is a counter for ‘Lazer’, set at 0, which, to me, symbolized the lack of a future for the character, and it was up to the player to destroy as many zombies as possible in order to change the future of the character, and indeed, the world he lives in.

I really love the lack of a menu, as it symbolizes the lack of options humanity has in this post-apocalyptic world. The Resolution is locked at 800x600, the optimal resolution for playing this masterpiece. Pressing Esc does absolutely nothing, symbolizing the inability for your character to escape the situation he is in. At the end of the park you find yourself in, there is a large pink circle with “Evacuation Zone” written on it, showing that your character has no way out, and must fight until the end.

The lack of a soundtrack really draws the player into full immersion, as all you can her is the sound of the darkness.

Graphics: 10
This game just looks fantastic, the zombies are terrifyingly realistic, the ground and tree textures look almost photorealistic.

Sound: 10
The game has no soundtrack, and it doesn’t need one, all of the sounds add to the horror elements, as I felt like I was really there.

Functionality: 10
I encountered absolutely no glitches during this game. I did see a few invisible ZOEDS, but I am sure that was intentional, a completely new enemy type.

Overall, I have to give this game a 10 out of 10, and recommend it to anyone who enjoys survival horror games, horror games, survival games, zombie games, or just games in general, theres something for everyone here. A must buy.
